title: Poster, "Masculine, Feminine", 1966
medium: Offset lithograph on wove paper, mounted on thick wove paper
markings:
printed in black ink, aligned with left margin of poster: SONiS (inscribed in rectangle with black ground)
printed in black ink, bottom left corner: stencil with Columbia Pictures logo: black ink ground with ruled border, leaving a void where 'Columbia' is in script (paper showing through stencil creates script). / INTERDIT AUX MOINS DE 18 ANS
printed in black ink, bottom left of center: Visa Ministeriel no 2063
printed in black ink, bottom right corner: ATELIERS LALANDE - WISSOUS  [S.-et-o.] - 920.98.7
signed: printed in black ink, aligned with left margin: d'apres G. KERFYSER
provenance: Acquired from dealers, galleries and auction houses by Marc Benda.  Remained with Benda until 2010, when gifted to CHNDM.
creditline: Gift of Sara and Marc Benda
description: On white background, a circle in top three-quarters of the composition, within which is a photograph of faces of apathetic young man and teasing woman. Below, overlapping, an image of the back of a woman adjusting her hair, flanked by two smaller photographs of men as they appear walking on the street, and a photograph of a walking couple, the woman holding an umbrella. The inscriptions are: (1) upper left, "le sexe / et la / jeunesse / de la / France / d'aujourd'hui" (2) "masculin feminin" at three-quarters center, on perpendicular planes (3) lower right, "de / JEAN-LUC GODARD / avec / CHANTAL GOYA et JEANE-PIERRE LEAUD / une production franco-suedoise / anouchka films-argos films-paris / svensk filmindustri-sandrews-stockholm".

tombstone.epitaph:
Poster, "Masculine, Feminine", 1966.
1966. Offset lithograph on wove paper, mounted on thick wove paper. Gift of Sara and Marc Benda. 2010-21-8.
